intro: Mangifera sumbawaensis, commonly known as the Sumbawa mango, is a tropical tree native to the island of Sumbawa in Indonesia. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and fragrant, yellow-orange fruits. The fruit has a sweet and aromatic pulp, often with a distinct flavor compared to other mango varieties. It thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil, and is typically propagated through seeds or grafting. Due to its limited distribution and unique characteristics, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
